headline: AI Transforming the Machinery Industry Through Manufacturing Execution Systems (MES)
summary: Delray Beach, FL, Oct. 30, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Artificial Intelligence (AI) has become a defining force in the machinery and manufacturing sectors, reshaping how production systems are managed, optimized, and scaled. Among all digital transformation tools, the Manufacturing Execution System (MES) stands out as the central nervous system of modern manufacturing operations. headline: The U.S. Wants to Test Nukes. What That Means for Defense Stocks.
summary: President Donald Trump wants the Department of Defense to start testing nuclear weapons again, something America hasn’t done since 1992.  For now, investors want to know what it could mean for defense stocks.  The short answer is not much—though they might want to brush up on America’s nuclear capabilities.

headline: Solstice Advanced Materials Starts Trading. It’s a Play on AI and Nuclear Power.
summary: The Honeywell spinoff Solstice Advanced Materials hopes to be a growth company serving nuclear power and semiconductor customers, among others.

headline: Honeywell completes spinoff of Solstice Advanced Materials
summary: The Solstice assets — which create materials for refrigerants, semiconductors and other sectors — generated net sales of $3.8 billion last year. The separation advances Honeywell’s strategy to split into three companies.

raw.headline: Honeywell completes spinoff of Solstice Advanced Materials
raw.summary: The Solstice assets — which create materials for refrigerants, semiconductors and other sectors — generated net sales of $3.8 billion last year. The separation advances Honeywell’s strategy to split into three companies.

headline: HONEYWELL COMPLETES SPIN-OFF OF SOLSTICE ADVANCED MATERIALS
summary: Honeywell (NASDAQ: HON) today announced that it has completed the previously announced spin-off of its Advanced Materials business, now operating as Solstice Advanced Materials. Shares of Solstice common stock will begin trading "regular way" on the Nasdaq Stock Market under the ticker symbol "SOLS," effective at the market opening today. Honeywell will continue to trade "regular way" on the Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "HON."

headline: SOLSTICE ADVANCED MATERIALS COMPLETES SPIN-OFF FROM HONEYWELL AND BEGINS TRADING ON NASDAQ
summary: Solstice Advanced Materials (NASDAQ: SOLS), a leading pure-play specialty materials company, today celebrates its first day as an independent, publicly traded company following the completion of its spin-off from Honeywell. Shares of Solstice will begin trading on the Nasdaq Stock Market under the ticker symbol "SOLS," effective at the market opening.

headline: How CarMax's (KMX) Shift from S&P 500 to S&P 600 May Affect Investor Positioning
summary: S&P Dow Jones Indices recently announced that CarMax has been removed from the S&P 500 following Honeywell's spinoff of Solstice Advance Materials, and is now part of the S&P 600 index. This index reclassification reflects changes in CarMax's market capitalization and triggers investment shifts among institutional managers tracking these benchmarks. We’ll examine how CarMax’s move from the S&P 500 to the S&P 600 may influence its investment outlook and position. These 11 companies survived...

headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From Honeywell’s Q3 Earnings Call
summary: Honeywell’s third quarter was marked by broad-based organic sales growth and robust order momentum, which management attributed to recent investments in new product development and operational execution across its core segments. CEO Vimal Kapur highlighted that organic sales growth outpaced expectations, with double-digit increases in Aerospace and ongoing strength in Building Automation, driven by “commitment to developing new solutions that solve our customers’ most challenging problems.” Nota
